source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Iridaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conn, B.J. (1994). Iridaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers with perianth lobes green, pink, lilac and/or white, only the perianth tube yellow; 'inner' primary bract green with margin dry and membranous or wholly dry and membranous
Flowers 8–15 mm long; perianth lobes obtuse, 5–9 mm long; anthers 1.5–2 mm long
Flowers 15–38 mm long; perianth lobes acute, 10–38 mm long; anthers 3–10 mm long
